text: Aspergillus kanagawaensis is a species of fungus in the genus Aspergillus. It is from the Cervini section. The species was first described in 1951.Nehira 1951, J. Jap. Bot. 26: 109 It has been reported to a few extrolites, including two polar indol-alkaloids and one polar indol-alkaloid. ==Growth and morphology== A. kanagawaensis has been cultivated on both Czapek yeast extract agar (CYA) plates and Malt Extract Agar Oxoid® (MEAOX) plates. The growth morphology of the colonies can be seen in the pictures below. Aspergillus_kanagawaensis_cya.png|Aspergillus kanagawaensis growing on CYA plate Aspergillus_kanagawaensis_meaox.png|Aspergillus kanagawaensis growing on MEAOX plate == References == kanagawaensis Category:Fungi described in 1951
title: Aspergillus kanagawaensis
